Erowid name: methadone
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Donate now and receive yours!

Methadone



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Methadose; Dolophine; Symoron; Juice

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Opioid; Analgesic

CHEMICAL NAME

6-dimethylamino-4,4-diphenyl-3-heptanone

DESCRIPTION

Methadone is a synthetic opiate derivative / opioid that is most commonly used as a maintenance treatment for heroin and opiate addiction.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

McDermotts Guide to the Depressant Drugs

Methadone & Drug Tests

Brief Info on Addiction

ARTICLES & WRITINGS #

, 1972

EXPERIENCES #

What Has Two Years of It Gotten Me?, by

Will You Marry Me?, by Bethany

Method Death, by Nog

Life Saving, by Josh

Completely Ecstatic, by rec_user

Â» Â» Â» MORE Â» Â» Â»

OFF-SITE RESOURCES

PRIMARY RESOURCES #

Drug Policy Alliance: Methadone

Methadone Today.org

Prescribing Methadone, Pursuing Abstinence

SECONDARY RESOURCES #

Methadone - Wikipedia.org

Methadone - TripSit.me


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information about methadone, including its common and brand names, effects classification, chemical name, and a brief description of its use as a synthetic opioid for maintenance treatment of heroin and opiate addiction. It also links to related topics such as health, law, dosage, chemistry, general information, user experiences, articles, and off-site resources, all within Erowid's comprehensive index of psychoactive substances and drugs.
